description:

description:
|  VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility.
Built on VMware's industry-leading virtualization technology, our solutions
deliver a new model of IT that is fluid, instant and more secure. Customers
can innovate faster by rapidly developing, automatically delivering and more
safely consuming any application.  
  
With 2015 revenues of $6.6 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers,
more than 75,000 partners, and 19,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the
world. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution,
passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff
you've always dreamed about?  
  
As a Solution Architect you will use your knowledge and experience to help
drive post-sales product implementation and integration with key customers,
both direct and through channel partners. We are looking for a person who has
the right mindset to be a part of an elite tiger team of solution architects.
You must possess a unique blend of polished customer-facing skills, strong
learning development and presentation skills, and technical savvy; an out of
the box thinker, and the drive to engage all stakeholders with emphasis on
complete customer satisfaction. Solution Architect is a fast-paced role where
the successful candidate will wear many hats, and where you will be part of
the GSAAS team that embraces open communication, empowerment, innovation,
teamwork and a shared focus on customer success. Working with customers who
have already purchased, but not yet deployed VMware’s NSX product, in this
role you will ensure customer success and maximum value from their purchase by
providing Use Case definition workshops, feature walkthroughs, knowledge
transfer and best practices, and use case recommendations to accelerate
adoption at scale. You will also support strategic partners in growing their
capabilities through the development and delivery of training, ride along and
shadowing to help drive scale through VMware’s extensive partner community.  
  
Responsibilities:  
\- Design and develop innovative solutions to customer requirements using our
Network Virtualization & Security products.  
\- Maintain current architecture, design, implementation and troubleshooting
knowledge of the VMware SDDC Suite and Horizon Suite of products.  
\- Assist in the development and implementation of standard reusable VMware
consulting service offerings, including definition of tasks, deliverables and
estimates  
\- Document best practices in developing and deploying Virtual Networking
& Security solutions, and feed them into our knowledgebase for reuse by
customers and partners  
\- Develop training content based on experience of making customers successful
with the technology. Content consists of: whiteboard lectures, hands-on labs
with manuals, slide shows, etc.  
\- Travel around the geography (Americas, Europe, Asia/Pacific) presenting
training to channel partners (while maintaining highest levels of student
satisfaction) on how to sell and deliver virtual networking and security
solutions.  
\- Drive escalated support issues for key accounts as needed in tight
cooperation with VMware GSS. Bring a sense of ownership to drive end to end
Customer success.  
\- Lead on-site Customer Advisory workshops related to Use Case Development,
Design Assessment and Operational Best Practices.  
\- Recruit and mentor other technical staff  
\- Maintain per-customer view of reported issues, regularly communicate with
customers, sales account teams, NSBU Product Management and Engineering, and
GSS  
\- Successful track record with software & network virtualization and/or
cloud infrastructure experience with customer software integration.  
\- Drive client and internal resources and activities to ensure deliverables
within tight scope and time lines to ensure customer satisfaction and scale.  
\- Document all customer-specific configurations for GSS and PSO to share
account intelligence.  
\- Develop/improve workflow for more efficient delivery and reduced overall
time to production  
\- Work closely with NSBU Development to deliver high quality, personalized
support to assigned client projects. Drive customer satisfaction as well as
product supportability improvement  
\- Bring thought leadership around Product Success and self-driven to lead
with minimal supervision.  
\- Ability to travel  
  
Preferred Skills/Experience:  
\- Domain level understanding of Cloud Infrastructure & Networking (Data
Center Design, Network Architecture, Network Design, System Architecture
Virtualization, Systems Management, Security, Cloud Consumption)  
\- Strong IT Infrastructure experience  
\- Experience in customer-facing positions as a professional services  
\- Technical support experience dealing with product escalation of Cloud
technologies.  
\- Experience with modern software development methodologies, with emphasis on
software and hardware architecture, and infrastructure design and development  
\- Experience in a technical lead role for small-or medium-size teams  
-Experience developing and delivering technical software training: selling and delivering • Strong practical Windows Server or Linux systems administration skills   
\- VMware virtualization, networking and security products, solutions, and
services.  
\- Network Security Tool and Networking Concepts such as firewalls, IDS/IPS,
Load Balancers, Security/Trust Zones, L2 Switching and L3 routing. VLANs,
Unicast vs Multicast, Management Networks, routing, VPN and network design.  
\- Proven experience and deep knowledge of the networking technologies and
vendors such as Cisco, F5, Riverbed, Force10, Vyatta/Brocade, A10 Networks,
Arista, Infoblox, Palo Alto Networks  
\- Experience with specific network components such as ASR routers, switches,
firewalls, ASA, Virtual networking components VSG, 1000V), BGP & OSPF
protocol, Cisco UCS storage would be an advantage.  
  
-Good understanding of VMware and open source cloud consumption platforms such as vRealize Automation, Openstack , VMware Integrated Openstack (VIO) etc. Hands on deployment and troubleshooting experience with these products is a plus.  
\- CCNA, VCP-NV or equivalent certification and/or related work experience  
\- CCIE , VCDX-NV or equivalent is highly desirable.  
\- Familiarity with systems management concepts, processes and standards (e.g.
SNMP); capacity/performance management and tuning; and storage and network
management  
\- Understanding of modern IT production data center and Internet (ISP/ASP)
hosting operations  
\- Programming in Perl, Python, C/C++ or Unix shell are also an advantage  
\- B.S./B.A./M.S. degree or equivalent technical training  
\- Experience in software deployment in large-scale services in complex
environments  
\- Thrives in a small customer operation (tiger team) in high-visibility key
accounts.-• Ability to work collaboratively with product development team on
problem troubleshooting and driving product improvements  
\- Exceptional communication (written and verbal, internal and external) and
presentation skills  
\- Quality, out-of–the box thinker that is open-minded, creative, intelligent,
and self-confident  
-Highly entrepreneurial with a strong passion, urgency, energy, dedication, and an unrelenting drive to succeed and win  
-Team player that works well in collaborative situations and start-up environments  
  
VMware offers:  
\- Attractive compensation package  
\- Unique opportunity for professional development, enhanced by various
training options, regular performance discussions, working with teams of
world-wide Staffing and IT professionals  
\- Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and
beverage program, sport activities, open communication  
\- Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, team buildings and celebrations  
  
As part of the VMware global standards for integrity you will be required to
go through a pre-employment screening process before you join.  
  
All job applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.
title: Solution Architect

description:

• Often leads small to medium technical projects. Works with and under the

defined business segment. Provides advice on solution and integration
opportunities to defined segments.  
• Contributes to knowledge tools and communities, and ensures project
learning’s are documented and shared. Role models focuses on single customer.
Solves diverse and complex. May lead a project team.

requirements gathering, solution presentation, etc.  
• Capable to communicate directly with customer  
  
Qualifications  
  
Education and Experience Required:  
•Typically 5-7 years of professional experience and a Bachelor of Arts/Science
or equivalent degree in computer science or related area of study;  
  
Essential Knowledge and Skills Required:  
• System monitoring experience and deploying solutions;  
• Analytical and problem solving skills per customer specific requirements and
security  
• Experience working with HP Operations Manager 9.x  
• Experience with development and implementation of event interfaces
(adapters) and process automation for HP Operations Manager 9.x  
• Experience with Run Book Automation implementation, testing and deployment  
• Proficiency with database development (SQL) and management  
• Proficiency at programming in the Perl, Shell, VBS, Python, Java or PHP
programming languages  
• Proficiency utilizing JSON, XML frameworks  
• Experience with Operating Systems UNIX (Linux, Solaris, HPUX, AIX) and
Windows  
• Experience designing and developing software applications  
• Experience in Software Testing, and Problem Solving  
• Experience documenting software functionality, ability to integrate software
with existing systems  
• Effective presentation, written communication, and verbal communication
skills in English  
  
  
We offer a challenging role including:  
• Continuous learning and technical training opportunities  
• Great opportunity for professional development in the IT field

tech Services & Support throughout EMEA

description:
|  VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility.
Built on VMware's industry-leading virtualization technology, our solutions
deliver a new model of IT that is fluid, instant and more secure. Customers
can innovate faster by rapidly developing, automatically delivering and more
safely consuming any application.  
  
With 2015 revenues of $6.6 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers,
more than 75,000 partners, and 19,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the
world. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution,
passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff
you've always dreamed about?  
  
Summary  
  
VMware is looking for an End User Computing (EUC) Domain Lead to join its End
User Services organization. The role will be responsible for leading VMware
into the future of End User Support Responsibilities, including but are not
limited to leadership in the global roll out of PC and Mobile end point
management tools, oversight of standards around but not limited to VDI,
Desktop OS (Mac, Linux, Windows), mobile and hardware standards.  
In addition this person will maintaining a strong working relationship with
the EUC R&D organization to provide feedback and help deliver VMware
products internally to VMware employees (VMware on VMware).  
The role will cover design and lead the EUC domain with close integration into
other Infrastructure domains like server & storage, unified
communications, and networks.  
  
Experience  
  
The End User Computing Domain Lead should possess a proven track record of
designing at scale global enterprise end-user solutions and possess the
passion, enthusiasm and vision for leading VMware’s internal End User Services
strategy. The role requires a thought leader in End User Computing that can
provide direction and innovation for a team who provides end user support for
25,000 employees across the globe, while ensuring all solutions meet the needs
of IT Security and align with existing solutions currently delivered by
VMware. The individual must therefore welcome the challenge of aligning the
End User Support model with other domain Leads including and security,
standards and practices. This includes functions gathering business
requirements, creating reference architecture standards, creating design
documents, and presenting solutions to peers and executive staff. The EUS
Domain Lead will also have the technical skills necessary to recommend and
design solutions for a global organization while also bridging the gap between
new projects proposed by other teams and existing solutions provided by the
End User Services organization.  
  
The role will have the following key Responsibilities and Deliverables  
  
•Overall EUS Strategy for the following services: VDI, Mobile, OS, Backups,
Management Tools and operation best practices  
•Own and provide roadmaps for End User Services IT department, including
Service and product (OS, tool and hardware) roadmaps and sunset products that
are no longer filling business needs  
•Represent End User Services at cross-functional IT project review board
meetings and governance meetings  
•Governance, relationship and operational management for enterprise-wide
projects in the EUC domain  
•Create run-books, operating manuals and Technical Design documents for large
scale projects  
•Service Ownership and transition to operations teams to Train staff on
operation procedures for new products and initiatives  
•Provide input on annual IT projects, and provide technical review and
approval for PRD and BRDs within the End User Computing domain  
•Ensure technical alignment across projects in the EUS domain  
•Provide escalation point for technical staff as needed, and mentor technical
and non-technical peers  
•Lead for enterprise-wide projects, manage the impact of in the business, and
drive for innovation  
•Develop an end-to-end view of the solution requirements towards
infrastructure, will develop long-term target direction and drive its
implementation on a day to day basis.  
•Define end user service catalog standards on various End User Services
technologies, VDI, End point devices, MDM, PC, OSX, tablets, cloud backup,
mobiles.  
•Support a culture of innovation to foster a competitive advantage in the
Identity Management services area via technologies.  
•Responsible for proper communication with IT functions and business, and to
meet IT needs and goals together with the Infrastructure teams. Act as global
internal IT business partner.  
•Collaborate with colleagues within the domain leadership team to provide
technical design guidance that aligns with the enterprise vision and
applicable technical standards.  
  
Detailed Experience  
  
•10+ years overall experience on core End User Technologies  
•Expertise in assessment, design, build and implement End User Technologies
stack  
•Strong analytical skills, with strong problem-solving capability  
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to
influence and work collaboratively with other Senior leaders in the
organization  
•Self-starter and highly motivated individual who demonstrates the ability to
exercise sound judgment, prioritize and effectively meet deadlines while
working on multiple assignments simultaneously.  
•Must have a track record in implementing technologies in a global environment
(including different cultures).  
•Previous hands on experience with the following required:  
•Expertise in the overall End User Stack technologies and competency in Active
Directory  
•Experience working with MDM tools  
•Understanding of client management tools such as SCCM  
•Deep Operating System knowledge and migration expertise in Windows 7/8 OSX
and Linux  
•Create, maintain and distribute golden images of Windows, OSX, & Linux  
•Proven working experience with installing, configuring, testing and
troubleshooting UNIX/Linux within a lab and production environment  
•Experience with Linux Desktops such as Gnome, KDE or Enlightenment  
•Networking knowledge (OSI network layers, TCP/IP)  
•Scripting skills; developing, maintaining custom shell scripts, able to
troubleshoot scripts related to Python, Bourne, C shell, Korn or Perl  
•Java is a plus  
•Knowledge of package repositories such as apt and yum  
•Strong SSH experience is a plus  
•Knowledge on multi factor authentication  
•Must have a good understanding of building and operating IT systems and
services.  
•Must be highly creative, curious and a strong networker.  
•Expert level knowledge of VDI and supporting technologies required for the
delivery of virtual desktop services.  
•Knowledge on Server Technologies, VMWARE SDDC concepts knowledge, VSAN, NSX  
•Knowledge on Unified communication Technologies  
•Certifications are a plus (VCP-DCV, VCP- DT, VCAP, VCAP-DT, VCDX )  
  
VMware offers:  
  
\- Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus
scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long-term
incentives.  
\- Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced

description:
|  Adcash is a real-time advertising trading platform that delivers maximum
exposure for advertisers and a simple, effective way for publishers to make
money. We’re committed to delivering the best customer experience, by offering
powerful, convenient tools and backing them up with dedicated, multi-lingual
support. We come from all over the world, with 20 nationalities and 15
languages between us, meaning we’re a diverse team, but all with one aim: our
customer’s success.  
  
We need an experienced Software Engineer Manager to join our busy IT team in
Sofia and become part of an exciting and growing enterprise.  
  
In this role you will be responsible for the development of our current
products and software tools as well as future releases, new products and
ongoing improvements. To fill this position you need to have ample experience
and proficiency in all aspects of the software development process.  
While this position may not require an extensive amount of coding, technical
knowledge and a broad understanding of ways to implement solutions in managing
huge amount of data and working with the best online technologies across
applications will be necessary.  
  
So, what will you be doing, day to day? You will...  
  
Manage and supervise the local IT project managers located in Sofia.  
This includes:  
Manage iterative technical execution through product teams, promoting
collaboration, open dialogue and a positive work environment.  
Negotiate with product owners and fellow managers to predict and offset
project risk.  
Define the technical product specs.  
Focus on the professional development of the teams.  
Interact with stakeholders and departments to ensure Software team goals and
priorities align with project vision and strategic direction.  
Define/refine processes, methodologies and tools related to our Software
Factory.  
Strive to standardize and to formalize in the following up and the execution
of projects. You will be the source of documentation, guidance and metrics on
the practice of project management and execution.  
Manage and publish the accuracy and the veracity of the metrics used and
shared with the top management around the roadmap of the company.  
Monitoring and reporting on active projects and portfolios (following up
project until completion), and reporting progress for strategic decisions.  
Provides a synthesis of all the projects (closed, on-going and planned) and
gathers data such as estimation, planning, scheduling, resource allocation.  
  
If you’re interested, we need you to have...  
  
Leadership and enthusiasm for developing a team-focused work environment.  
Desire to work with a tight-knit, multi-disciplinary team.  
Contribute to development of new solutions and expand of existing ones.  
Ability to mentor project managers and other technical staff (validation and
infrastructure engineers).  
A broad understanding of software engineering and Agile methodology.  
Several years experience architecting software products.  
Understanding of Design Patterns, of database architecture, of API and bst.  
Competency in managing big data and oversight of algorithm development.  
Experience leading teams of 10+ engineers.  
Experience with management tools such as Atlassian suite (Confluence, Jira,
...).  
Fluent in English.  
Self-starter.  
Ability to meet tight deadlines.  
  
By joining us, you will become part of our dynamic and ever-growing team. We
offer unlimited opportunities for self-improvement and growth, a competitive
salary, friendly multicultural environment and a modern office in the city
center of Sofia.  
If you have awesome organisational, analytical and problem solving skills,
then we'd love to hear from you!

description:
|  БГСервиз е компания, фокусирана върху предоставянето на IT решения за
малкия и средния бизнес. Сред основните  
ни услуги са предоставяне на компютърна поддръжка, управление на ИТ проекти и
внедряване на различни  
софтуерни решения. Наред с работата ни с решенията на Microsoft ние твърдо
вярваме в ползите на отворения код. Поддържаме голямо количество сървъри под
Linux, а информационната система която разработваме е базирана на технологии с
отворен код.  
  
Търсим нов колега за нашия оперативен отдел, който да отговаря за разработка и
поддръжка на сървърни решения с отворен код.  
  
  
Основната отговорност на длъжността е да изгражда, поддържа и следи за
коректната работа на сървърни  
инфраструктури базирани на отворен код продукти. Задачите на позицията
включват:  
  
Инсталация и поддръжка на сървърни системи с отворен код;  
Работа със системата за проследяване и мониторинг на работещите системи;  
Установяване и отстраняване на проблемите отдалечено или на място при клиента;  
Диагностициране и отстраняване на проблеми, свързани с работата на софтуерни
продукти, мрежа или хардуерни  
проблеми;  
Решаване на ескалирани от второ ниво технически проблеми ;  
Отразяване на извършената работа в информационната система на фирмата;  
  
  
Изисквания на позицията :  
Познания и опит при работа с Ubuntu базирани системи  
Познания и опит при работа в следните области :  
а) Samba, OpenLDAP, rsync, rsnapshot  
b) Apache, php, mysql - инсталация, конфигурация, бекъпи  
c) Дискови масиви, както софтуерни така и хардуерни  
d) Мрежови конфигурации, рутери  
e) Postix, Zimbra(бонус), dovecot, cyrus  
f) Опит с виртуализация, KVM, Xen  
g) Ubuntu Server & Ubuntu desktop  
h) MikroTik настройка и конфигурация  
i) OpenVPN  
Предишен стаж и работа с Asterisk и/или FreePBX е предимство.  
  
Добри комуникативни умения  
Желание за работа в екип  
Много добро владеене на английски език  
Опит на подобна позиция минимум 2 години  
Шофьорска книжка  
  
Предложението:  
Дългосрочна позиция на пълен работен ден  
Обучение по време на работа  
Работа в коректна компания с млад и перспективен екип  
  
Проявявате интерес и отговаряте на нашите изисквания? Кандидатствайте по
нашата обява, а ние ще се свържем с Вас за интервю и технически тест.  
  
Не отговаряте на нашите изисквания, но искате да се занимавате с решения с
отворен код? Напишете Вашите причини да искате да работите такава работа
заедно с Вашето CV. Ще се свържем с Вас ако преценим, че можем да работи добре
заедно.

description:
|  TAD Group has an exciting opportunity for a Cyber Security Penetration
Tester to join our team.  
  
Simulating a cyber attack under controlled conditions is the best way to know
how potential intruders will actually approach networks. TAD Group is a
company which delivers network, application, wireless, and social engineering
engagements to evaluate the cyber security level of the key systems and
infrastructure of our clients.  
  
Responsibilities:  
• Perform formal penetration tests on web-based applications, networks and
computer systems  
• Conduct physical security assessments of servers, systems and network
devices  
• Design and create new penetration tools and tests  
• Probe for vulnerabilities in web applications, fat/thin client applications
and standard applications  
• Pinpoint methods that cyber attackers could use to exploit weaknesses and
logic flaws  
• Employ social engineering to uncover security holes (e.g. poor user security
practices or password policies)  
• Incorporate business considerations (e.g. loss of earnings due to downtime,
cost of engagement, etc.) into cyber security strategies  
• Research, document and discuss cyber security findings with management and
IT teams  
• Review and define requirements for cyber security solutions  
• Work on improvements for cyber security services, including the continuous
enhancement of existing methodology material and supporting assets  
• Provide feedback and verification as an organization fixes security issues  
  
Requirements:  
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering,
Telecommunications, or similar field required.  
• At least 1 year of cyber security-related experience with practice in
penetration testing and vulnerability assessments.  
• Windows, UNIX and Linux operating systems  
• Experience with penetration testing of popular Content Management Systems
(Wordpress, Joomla, etc.)  
• C, C++, C#, Java, PHP  
• Network servers and networking tools (e.g. Nessus, nmap, Burp, etc.)  
• Computer hardware and software systems  
• Web-based applications  
• Cyber security tools and products (Fortify, AppScan, etc.)  
• Vulnerability analysis and reverse engineering  
• Metasploit framework  
• Cryptography principles  
• Strong reporting and written documentation experience  
  
We offer:  
• A competitive remuneration package  
• A new team working in a visionary company with big potential  
• Flexible working hours (we focus on results)  
• Training and certification  
  
  
We would love to hear about your skills and your experience, as well as any
questions you might have.  
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. All applications will be
treated in strictest confidentiality.
title: Cyber Security Penetration Tester

description:
|

**COMPANY OVERVIEW:**

Hostway Corporation is a leader in Cloud, Managed, and Hybrid Hosting. Hostway
delivers reliable, secure, and scalable Infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS)
solutions to over 500,000 customers worldwide. Hostway has emerged as one of
the largest cloud hosting and Infrastructure-as-a-Service providers in the
world due to the company’s expertise in developing secure, multi-tenant
hosting environments and is committed to providing SMB's and large enterprises
with cost effective business solutions. Hostway’s core products include
Managed Hosting, Cloud Hosting, Web Hosting and Email and Applications.

**POSITION PURPOSE: **

Hostway Corporation is seeking individuals who are eager, energetic and highly
technical for a Software Developer Engineer position with our Engineering
Services Group, located in Sofia. The applicants will be expected to work in a
team oriented environment tackling tasks at various stages in the development
process ranging from requirements gathering to implementation and testing.
Emphasis is placed on the candidate's contribution to the group and their
advancement in understanding and helping extend and maintain Hostway's
technical infrastructure.

** ****ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  * Design, implement and test RESTful APIs communication with different backend systems.
  * Design, implement and test customer facing front-end web applications.
  * Work on test automation for various managed services and other company-specific product development projects.
  * Deliver quality code based on unit and automated acceptance tests.
  * Document and maintain the different systems; investigate and resolve existing problems.
  * Work collaboratively with other engineers and utilize agile development practices.

**DESIRED MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

  * BS or higher in Computer Science or equivalent field.
  * Excellent written and verbal communications expected as well as commitment to quality and customer satisfaction.
  * At least two years of programming experience in several programming languages such as: Python and PHP.
  * Extensive experience and knowledge of Object Oriented Programming/Development concepts and practices.
  * Experienced and comfortable with reviewing code written in a number of programming languages.
  * General understanding of networks and network programming techniques.
  * Familiarity with web-based applications and the benefits/limitations of HTML interfaces, including CGI and persistent server application frameworks, RESTful services.
  * Strong analytic mindset, the ability to decompose complex problems into simpler components, and the ability to organize and track complicated project plans.
  * Working knowledge of both UNIX and Windows in a software development setting. Prefer strength in UNIX (all flavors) environment.
  * Experience using version/change control systems (Git, Perforce).
  * Fluent written and spoken English.

**PREFERRED SKILLS:**

  * Experience with Java and JavaScript is a significant plus.
  * Previous experience working with iterative development methodologies, such as Extreme Programming, Scrum or Feature Driven Design.
  * Familiarity with relational database concepts and RDBMS systems such as MySQL, DB2 and SQL Server.
  * Ability to work collaboratively with peers in remote offices.
  * Experience mentoring junior development staff and promoting best practices within the organization.

**WHAT WE OFFER:**

  * An attractive remuneration package!
  * 25 days of annual paid leave! 
  * Work with an enthusiastic team of professionals!
  * Opportunity to work in an international and culturally diverse environment!
  * Opportunity for career development in an IT oriented international company!

**If you’re interested in applying for this position please send us a short cover letter and your CV in English. Hostway thanks all candidates for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.**

description:
|  Founded in 2004, Sofica Group has become the largest independent BPO
provider in Bulgaria, part of the American company TeleTech. Our experience
allows us to provide leading local and global clients with a broad range of
tailored BPO, ITO and HRO services. Currently we are searching for:  
  
Technical Account Manager  
  
General Summary:  
  
The Technical Account Manager is the primary point of contact to TeleTech
technology for both our internal and external clients during the lifecycle of
a client program. They are responsible for the successful management of the
programs as well as end-to-end technology including but not limited to
desktops, network infrastructure, servers, applications and reports. They are
also responsible for all communications to the client about all technology
issues, changes and new innovation initiatives.  
  
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:  
  
• Primary technology point of contact for operations, sales and external
clients for their program;  
• Participates closely with the management teams of TeleTech's Operations and
other business owners to ensure quality customer support;  
• Will be responsible for Implementing TeleTech standards for maintaining a
stable environment in addition to making recommendations for updated
standards;  
• Will have responsibility of ensuring that all aspects of technology for the
program are within contractual specifications as well as that all aspects of
technology are in full working order for their clients program;  
• Keeps a centralized tracker of YTD outages, issues, change requests,
penalties and technology related revenue for the program;  
• Helps manage resolution of Teletech agent impacting outages. Keeps client
posted of progress throughout the fix process and provides after action report
to client within contractually agreed upon time period;  
• Communicates planned changes to clients with detailed area of impact and
risk mitigation strategy within agreed notification timeframe, or best effort
thereof;  
• Receives new client work requests. Provides time and cost estimates for work
requests within two working days of request. Ensures work requests are
complete within agreed on timeline.  
• Implements and enforces project change management processes, including
documenting financial implications of changes and coordinating cross-
functional IT teams to get changes completed successfully.  
• Provides weekly status to internal and external clients for programs
technology - outages, change requests, etc. Provides a weekly summary of
client program status for the Weekly CIO update.  
  
Job Specifications:  
  
• 5 years managing Information Technology teams or project teams;  
• Experience working in Account Management with heavy client interaction;  
• 3-5 years experience in a call center environment;  
• Thorough knowledge of network protocols and operation, desktop operating
systems and capabilities, and troubleshooting techniques;  
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English;  
• Prefer certifiable technical skills. Acceptable certifications include but
are not limited to Associate or Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Microsoft
Certified Product Specialist (MCPS), Microsoft Certified Engineer (MSCE);  
• Must have a completed end-to-end understanding of the programs specific
technology – infrastructure and applications (desktop to datacenter);  
• Has a full understanding of the contractual agreement with regards to
technology specifications, SLA’s, penalties, change management and billing for
the program.  
  
If you consider we can make a good team together please send your CV in
English stating the position you are applying for.  
  
All documents will be treated in the strictest confidentiality.  
  
Only short-listed candidates will be invited for an interview.

description:
|  Job scope/summary:  
  
  
-To operate large IT outsourcing customers, HP Enterprise defined a standard operation framework; it is a set of IT service management processes (ITIL) and associated technical tooling solutions deployed across the whole customer base: workflow, monitoring, service level reporting, configuration database, discovery, patching, service request management tools, automation, etc.  
  
-The design will cover the end to end service management tools required to operate the client: ticketing tool, monitoring, reporting, patching, configuration database, system integrations, self-service customer portal, automation, etc.  
  
  
This position is within the Global Engineering and Technical Consulting (GETC)
organization, as part the Service Management and Tools capability. You will
own defining the service management tooling solution used by HPE to provide a
variety of IT outsourcing services to customers (workplace services,
datacenter services, storage, cloud solutions, etc.). For each customer, you
will steer the solution towards a maximum re-use of HPE standards. You will
also ensure that the service management tooling solution is fit for purpose
and in line with HPE contractual obligations. You will identify any solution
gap and address it, working closely with internal tooling experts, other HPE
departments or HPE Software professional services.  
  
  
You will primarily be engaged post-sales to define the tooling solution design
and provide technical guidance to the project team for implementation. You
will also bring your expertise in presales phase, to help sales to finalize
the high level design.  
  
  
You will need to work on complex problems where analysis of situations or data
requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. The position requires to
act as an end to end architect/solution designer, providing directions and
working with tools and process experts, each for their domain. You will need
to lead and/or provide technical expertise to functional project team working
closely with project managers.  
  
  
  
Job specifics/responsibilities:  
  
\- Lead the onboarding of new clients into HPE standard tooling framework:
define and document the high level design, maximize re-use of existing
standard building blocks and address any gaps.  
  
\- The design will cover the end to end service management tools required to
operate the client: ticketing tool, monitoring, reporting, patching,
configuration database, system integrations, self-service customer portal,
automation, etc.  
  
\- Evaluate current state, determine future state and design/document the HPE
tooling architecture and the integration points with customer systems.  
\- Own documenting the high level design. Review and sign-off the design with
internal HPE stakeholders and customer representatives.  
  
\- Guide experts who will produce low level designs, each for the tool/process
they are responsible for. Ensure the end to end solution is fit for purpose,
cost effective and leverages HPE standards.  
  
\- Review the solution against HPE contractual obligations and compare with
the planned service management solution. Highlight any risk/gap and work
closely with the project manager and project team to close them.  
  
\- Collaborate with the project manager to help define work break down
structures and detailed project plans  
\- Oversee and provide technical governance to the team during implementation
and test phases  
\- Engage in presales opportunities to drive standards, advise sales and
define solutions to achieve customer requirements.  
\- Focus on the solution design  
-Document known risks and assumptions  
-Review draft statement of work  
\- Contribute to the definition of the required implementation effort  
\- Capture and share lessons learnt, contribute to HPE tools architect
community sharing and receiving information  
\- Identify potential improvements in the service management solutions used
across the customer base. Contribute to specifying these improvements.  
  
  
Qualifications  
  
  
Education (degree) and professional experience required:  
  
\- 10+ years of professional experience and a master degree in engineering,
computer science, Management information systems. Relevant experience in IT
outsourcing or within a large IT department.  
  
Essential:  
  
\- Strong technical background with past exposure to multiple IT technologies
(networking, wintel/linux, apps development, cloud, workplace solutions)  
\- Past experience of designing and implementing IT services and solutions.  
\- Exposure to service management tools and processes, at minimum as a user  
-Client facing experience  
  
  
Desirable:  
  
\- Experience/understanding of a variety of service management tools sold by
HPE or competitors: Self-service portal, request management portal, system
integration, discovery tools, uCMDB or other configuration tools, HPE
operation manager or equivalent monitoring tools, Business Service Management,
HPE Service Manager workflow tool, business intelligence reporting, etc.  
-Past project management experience  
-Network security concepts  
-ITIL V3 foundation, TOGAF v9 is a plus  
  
  
Personal skills and qualities:  
\- Demonstrated ability to work with large worldwide remote cross-functional
teams.  
\- Comfort working with all levels of a business or IT organization.  
\- Strong leadership and ownership  
\- Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills, good communicator and facilitator  
\- Technical background and interest, allowing the candidate to quickly
understand a new solution  
  
  
  
We offer a challenging role including:  
• Continuous learning and technical training opportunities  
• Great opportunity for professional development in the IT field  
• Part in a team that has established itself as a preferred partner for Hi-
tech Services & Support throughout EMEA

Global Engineering & Technical Consulting (GE&TC) is an organization

takes accountability for infrastructure design and build, develops
architecture, strategy and roadmaps, performs IT workload migration and leads
infrastructure deployments.  
  
  
Profile summary:  
  
You will be responsible for managing software deployments in a multi-site SCCM
2007 R2 or SCCM 2012 environments. You will apply your expert knowledge in
Microsoft Systems Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) 2007 or 2012 to design
and lead implementation of medium to large environments, along with OS
deployment, software distribution and patch management processes. You are
expected to demonstrate solid understanding of client/server, networking, and
Internet fundamentals.

effective relationships with customers.

technical specification.

estimate risks.

distribution and patch management solutions based on MS SCCM 2007/2012.  
•Prepare implementation and migration plans, test cases and deployment
documentation.  
•Implement proof of concept environment and execute test scenarios to
demonstrate that solution is fit for purpose.

environment.

years of relevant experience.  
• 5+ years of experience building and supporting OS deployment, software
distribution and patch management solutions.  
• 2+ years of experience engineering OS deployment, software distribution and

SCCM 2007/2012 environments.

deployment strategies.

maintenance windows.  
• Hands on experience downloading and deploying patches using WSUS with SCCM
2007/2012.

environments.  
• Packaging and scripting experience with Flexera AdminStudio/Wise Studio,
VBscript and PowerShell.  
• Broad knowledge of desktop/server technologies and how they can be applied
to solve business problems.

Technical background in one or more of the following is considered as

description:
|  Description  
  
Global Engineering and Technical Consulting team is responsible for
architecture and engineering and integration of DCS & Cloud solutions
based on the standards or nonstandard portfolio offerings. Often our services
are utilized during the transformation phase to help a client move from
“current state” to “future state”. We enable accounts and delivery teams to
provide DCS and Cloud Services that were contracted with the client.  
  
  
Job scope / Summary  
  
Applies Windows Operating System technical knowledge to solve complex business
requirements and is regarded as a subject matter expert. Uses consulting
skills including, but not limited to: interviewing clients to understand
business needs, developing technical solutions, migration plans and working
with multiple teams to accomplish project deliverables. Capable of consulting,
designing, testing, implementing, managing capability requirements into a new
or existing infrastructure using HP methodology. Able to integrate custom
software components into the environment and provide third level production
infrastructure support.

•Responsible for client/account interactions as required

Technical Lead

Administrators for migrating from the CMO to the FMO

deployment procedures and operation/support procedures following the Global

•Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical
Engineering, Management Information Systems, MBA or equivalent

•English fluent mandatory

•Demonstrates specialist understanding of both server hardware & server
operating system deployment, configuration, testing & administration.

migration tools: DoubleTake, Platespin, VMWare vCenter Converter, Robocopy,
AppZero

principles with prior experience of working in PowerShell, VBScript and
associated scripting/mark-up languages (e.g. Batch files, HTML, and XML).  
•Experienced troubleshooting to a specialist level within Microsoft Windows
Server Network Infrastructures.  
•Knowledge and understanding of:  
  
◦Microsoft Active Directory  
◦Core Windows Network Services  
◦Advanced Windows Network Services

Technical background in one or more of the following is considered as

•Private Cloud and Virtual Private Cloud technologies

◦File and Print Server Migrations  
◦Microsoft Cluster Service (Windows 2003) and Failover Clustering (Windows

◦Active Directory and DNS

•Experience with Storage Solutions

broad spectrum of HP technology in order to provide part or all of a detailed
technical design which meets customer  
requirements.

direction of the Project/Technical Manager and  
with customer nominated representatives. Liaises with Solutions Architect as
appropriate.  
· Provides technical support and input on the application of technology to a
defined business segment. Provides advice on  
solution and integration opportunities to defined segments.  
· Provides technical leadership on specific integration activities that are
part of an engagement.  
· Provides planning and design support for the development of solution
architectures that will be implemented in a multiple  
system environment.  
· Communicates across client community, and is viewed as adding value.
Demonstrates execution of the HP strategy.  
· Contributes to knowledge tools and communities, and ensures project
learning’s are documented and shared. Role  
models Focuses on single customer. Solves diverse and complex. May lead a
project team.  
  
  
Qualifications  
  
Education and Experience Required:  
  
\- 5+ years of professional experience and a Bachelor of Arts/Science or
equivalent degree in computer science or related area of study; without a
degree, three additional years of relevant professional experience (8+ years
in total).  
Essential Knowledge and Skills Required:  
\- UNIX & Linux (AIX, RHEL and SUSE Linux ) with sound knowledge of OS
virtualisation, SAN storage connectivity,  
server storage management software configuration and high-availability
clustering. Candidate should have experience  
in designing the solutions, implementation and troubleshooting and guiding of
UNIX and Linux projects throughout the  
project lifecycle.  
  
Desirable Knowledge and Skills Required:  
  
Other UNIX/Linux flavours (e.g. HP-UX/Solaris) would also preferred. Good
knowledge of high-end hardware systems,  
storage and clusters, as well as LAN/SAN with virtualisation knowledge. Any
knowledge of scripting would be added  
advantage. Experience of working under time pressures in a project delivery
environment of complex UNIX/Linux  
environment with good communication skills in English  
· Has sufficient depth and breadth of technical knowledge to be individually
responsible for the design and scope of  
deliverables within a field of expertise. Has led small team in delivery of a
specific deliverable.  
· Has mastered at least one technical discipline with strong knowledge in at
least three major technology areas.  
· Able to communicate and present complex issues with assurance and
confidence. Demonstrates the use of consulting  
skills including: questioning, listening, ideas development, permission and
rapport, and influencing.

The Global Engineering and Technical Consulting team is responsible for
architecture and engineering and integration of DCS & Cloud solutions
based on the standards or nonstandard portfolio offerings. Often our services
are utilized during the transformation phase to help a client move from
“current state” to “future state”. We enable accounts and delivery teams to
provide DCS and Cloud Services that were contracted with the client.  
  
The Technology Architect provides technical leadership for development of
Future Mode of Operation designs and technical migration plans for DCS &
Cloud:  
  
-End to End responsibility for technical content of deliverables produced by Global Engineering & Technical Consulting (GE&TC) – DCS & Cloud  
-Translate functional requirements to technical requirements  
-Promote standardization and automation during transformation in T&T engagements  
-Ensure developed solutions are aligned with engineering repositories (Playbooks, CMR) and Portfolio websites/repositories (What we sell, EG Portfolio portals).

-Thought Leadership / Technical Point Of Contact for HP tower/project teams.   
-Produces High Level Design and approve Low Level Designs for end to end coherency.

-Support Hand-over to production of implemented solutions

-Onboarding  
-High Level Design completion and sign-off  
-Solution None Standard Service Requests  
-Solution owner during implementation

services

We live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology

mobile.  
At IBM, you’ll collaborate with extraordinary professionals in a creative
environment to make the world work better.

post sale Remote Technical Software
